result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Marie Frye

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Marie Frye.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF71 and 22CF279. Court notes live stream. In 22CF279, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status on both cases. State is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:45 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Marie Frye.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Marie Frye.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates calling new file as well, 22CF279. In new file, acknowledges receipt, waives reading, not guilty pleas, asks for preliminary hearing. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. 
State requests signature bond of $3,000, conditions of no contact with victim 1, 2 or 3. No objection.
Court orders $3000 signature bond, no contact with Victims 1, 2 or 3.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Marie Frye.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman states information has not been filed. Attorney Kruger to file information. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.pdf
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Marie Frye.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness, Officer Christopher Moe. Witness sworn and testifies. State direct exam. Police department, over 20 years. Summarizes work experience. Has had prior police contacts with defendant. Witness identifies defendant. Court notes defendant identified. November 13, 2021 report. Fraudulent charges made on Green Dot card to Superior Water Light and Power. Indicates other fraudulent charges made on same account around same time.  Defendant had access to victim's computers. Defendant interviewed by officers on February 17, 2022. 
Attorney Hoffman cross exams witness. 
State rests.  Witness steps down. No further witnesses.
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney Hoffman makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:56
Defendant Kayla Frye appears in court.  ADA Peter Kruger appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews file; Public defender indicated emergency and couldn't be here.
Court informs defendant of her options-can go forward today or reschedule.
Defendant wishes to reschedule.
Court finds good cause to reschedule and go outside of time limits
States' Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: 01:41 PM Defendant Kayla Marie Frye in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman waives reading and requests preliminary hearing on . Court accepts not guilty plea. Court verifies address. Defendant was RTA'd to appear today. State requests $2,500 signature bond and condition of no contact with Victim #1.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
